instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message:
So power comes in on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>::16 which is a nice steady 12.62v.
But <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> which exits on ::17 is fluctuating.

So my questions is, could <TRANSISTOR>Q7840</TRANSISTOR> be the problem causing <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> to brown out and reset, or should I just replace <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message:
12.62V is a bit high, should be 12.56V, check sense resistors.......

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is also fluctuating???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 15778"]12.62V is a bit high, should be 12.56V, check sense resistors.......[/QUOTE]
Yes, but I figured many components aren't running. Will check and report back shortly.

[QUOTE]<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is also fluctuating???[/QUOTE]
Correct. From 0 - 3.5v

It seems <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is fluctuating too now (at least it is at <CHIP>U7941</CHIP>). Didn't pick up on that yesterday.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message: Actually <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is stable almost everywhere else. :|

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message: I've lost the green light and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is going from 16.75 to 15.86 and back again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message: Is this water damage???? Does it work with a pre charged battery???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message:
Doesn't appear to be water damaged and is really clean.

Doesn't work off a battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message: First get green light back. 3V42 present? <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> high? If both are OK first suspect is crap under the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> is 0.
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is missing not completely now.

Seems to be going backwards quickly. :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message: Fix 3V42 first, you should be able to do that on your own now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> Pin 17 fluctuating.
threads.message:
Please explain whether [I]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is missing not completely now[/I] means you have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> or don't. 

What voltages do you have at pins 1, 3, 4, 6,  and 7 of <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>?
